## Conversation that answers the provided questions:
**User:**
I'm curious about the concept of Public Blockchains as a Service (PBaaS) on the Verus network. Can you explain what it is and how it enables the creation of public blockchains?

**AI Assistant:**
Public Blockchains as a Service (PBaaS) is a fascinating technology that allows for the decentralized and automated creation of public blockchains. I'd be happy to break it down for you.

On the Verus network, PBaaS enables anyone with a small amount of VerusCoin (or Verus Test Coin) to define and launch their own public blockchain in a matter of minutes. This is made possible through an intuitive Graphical User Interface (GUI) wallet, where users can easily create and configure their own blockchain.

Once created, any miner on the Verus network can see the new chain and merge-mine it with Verus, along with 13 other chains. This means that the hash power of Verus miners will also apply to the new chain, providing additional security and protection against various forms of attack.

Moreover, the new chain is automatically cross-validated through Verus, further bolstering its security and decentralization. This technology enables the creation of a highly scalable, decentralized, and secure ecosystem of blockchain applications, making it easy for anyone to participate and create their own blockchain-based projects.

If you're interested in getting started with creating a public blockchain on the Verus Testnet, you can follow a simple guide that involves downloading the GUI Wallet Tech Release, starting the Verus Test chain, and configuring your new blockchain. If any issues arise, you can seek help from the Verus community or refer to the FAQ page for troubleshooting.

Do you have any more questions about PBaaS or creating public blockchains on the Verus network?
What is Public Blockchains as a Service (PBaaS) and how does it enable the creation of public blockchains on the Verus network?

Public Blockchains as a Service (PBaaS) is a technology that allows for the decentralized and automated creation of public blockchains. On the Verus network, PBaaS enables anyone with a small amount of VerusCoin (or Verus Test Coin) to define and launch their own public blockchain in a matter of minutes.

Using an intuitive Graphical User Interface (GUI) wallet, users can easily create and configure their own blockchain. Once created, any miner on the Verus network can see the new chain and merge-mine it with Verus, along with 13 other chains. This means that the hash power of Verus miners will also apply to the new chain, providing additional security and protection against various forms of attack.

Moreover, the new chain is automatically cross-validated through Verus, further bolstering its security and decentralization. This technology enables the creation of a highly scalable, decentralized, and secure ecosystem of blockchain applications, making it easy for anyone to participate and create their own blockchain-based projects.

To get started with creating a public blockchain on the Verus Testnet, users can follow a simple guide that involves downloading the GUI Wallet Tech Release, starting the Verus Test chain, and configuring their new blockchain. If any issues arise, users can seek help from the Verus community or refer to the FAQ page for troubleshooting.

Any miner will be able to see your new chain as soon as it’s created, and merge-mine your chain with Verus, along with 13 other chains as well, meaning, they’re hashpower on Verus will apply to your chain too. But don’t trust me, verify my claims yourself on the VerusCoin test-net by following a simple guide.
How to create your own chain on the Verus Testnet
1 – Download the GUI Wallet Tech Release
To get started, simply head to this GitHub page, and download the latest desktop wallet for your operating system.
2 – Start the Verus Test chain
Click Add Coin, select VRSCTEST, and select “Activate Coin”. This will either spin up VRSCTEST, or, you’ll be prompted to download any required ZCash parameters. If prompted, choose a server, and download the parameters. After the download is done, redo this step.
If you’re having trouble getting it to start, don’t worry! Check out this FAQ page, or ask the community for help in one of the Verus Discord channels here.
